Abstract: The advent of additive manufacturing (AM) has revolutionized the design and fabrication of soft actuators and robots, offering unprecedented flexibility in creating complex, functional structures. This paper explores the integration of AM techniques, including 4D printing, in the development of soft robots that exhibit enhanced adaptability, efficiency, and functionality. By leveraging the unique capabilities of AM, researchers can now fabricate integrated soft actuators and sensors with intricate geometries and tailored material properties, enabling the realization of robots that can perform delicate tasks in unstructured environments. The discussion highlights recent advancements in the field, focusing on the design principles, material selection, and fabrication strategies that underpin the development of these innovative systems. Furthermore, the paper addresses the challenges and future directions in the application of AM to soft robotics, emphasizing the potential for creating more autonomous, intelligent, and versatile robotic systems.
